turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello. Hi, I'm Doctor Jacob and welcome to Babylon. How are you doing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm OK, thank you. Um, not feeling that great actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Good. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright. I can't see your face properly <UNIN/>, just, yeah that's it. That's good. Thank you. So, I'm sorry to hear that. But just before we start, is it alright if you could confirm your name for me please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm Mary Jane Grey, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Date of birth?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Date of birth, um nineteen eighty.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And your address for me please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I live <UNIN/> on SW four zero NG.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's correct. And just to confirm that you're in a secure location, and we can have a confidential conversation.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So you've mentioned that you're feeling dizzy. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, yes.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I'm feeling I'm, I'm yeah, I'm feeling very sick. It's probably because i'm feeling dizzy, um the the room is sort of spinning, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I, I can't, I can't walk properly. Uh, well I can walk properly but not straight, um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: and my ears are buzzing a bit. I'm just, they're feeling a bit off.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Mm-hmm</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, <UNSURE>ear's buzzing</UNSURE>. So when did it all start?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Started probably about two hours ago maybe. but I, I, um, I had a a similar sort of thing about a month ago, um

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But I didn't really think anything of it, 'cause it <UNIN/> it settled quite quickly. Um, but this has been going for a bit more now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So you <UNSURE>said</UNSURE>, you mentioned it started a few hours ago. So <UNIN/> did it start? What were you doing?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I was just actually making my husband some breakfast, um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I, yeah, I just suddenly felt very fuzzy and dizzy, um, and a bit shaky.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So <UNIN/> you <UNSURE>mentioned</UNSURE>, like the room spinning around?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And is, how long does it last for? Or is it there now, continuously now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah it's, it's there, the whole time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So it's there now for the past two hours you'd say, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Did you have any kind of viral illness in the recent past, past couple of weeks?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No cold, cough, nothing.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I've been pretty healthy I think, um, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, OK. Um, you've mentioned that you have a, some ear buzzing kind of thing. Any kind of ear pain or ear discharge, anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, nothing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you have a temperature at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I don't think so, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, right. You also mentioned that you can walk, but you're not walking straight. Why is that? Is it because

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think just 'cause the room feels like it's moving a bit. Um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Feels like to move</UNSURE> <UNIN/>. That's why you're feeling like you're a bit unsteady, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>I'll look</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> My, my legs and arms and everything are working fine I just, I don't feel like I'm <UNIN/> stable. My, the room is <UNIN/> spinning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So there's no weakness of your arms and legs. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: K. Right. Um, so you mentioned you had something like this a month ago. So how, how, how long did that episode last for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Probably only about five, ten minutes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, right. And do you have any problems hearing at the moment? Like, is it <UNIN/> muffled or something?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: It's just a bit of a buzzy noise in my ears, but otherwise I can hear everything.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNSURE>Righty-ho</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, have you been physically sick?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, but now I'm feeling very sick.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Nausea, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Righty-ho. And, I don't have much information of your past medical history. So is there any medical conditions you'd like to <UNIN/> tell me, surgical, medical conditions?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've had premature ovarian failure, um, and I've taken HRT.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK <UNSURE>charting premature hearing failure</UNSURE>. OK, and um any other medications at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, do you have any allergies at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Right. OK so <UNIN/>, talking to you today, um, in the <UNIN/>, the most common um, you know, diagnosis we would <UNIN/> you're suffering from at the moment is something called labyrinthitis. Yeah?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, that's when your middle ear...there is something um, some inflammation going on there, and there is some imbalances in the crystals there in your middle ear.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so what the most important treatment is actually giving you some kind of middle ear <UNSURE>stability </UNSURE> so that you won't feel as if you're going around in a boat, kind of feeling.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK? So that's what we need to <UNIN/>. Because to actually make you <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> function a bit more, we'll start you on certain medications.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I would still like you to be seen by one of our doctors to take a look inside your ears to just make sure. So this is like just symptomatic relief like you have a fever we just give paracetamol.  So just to, you know, make you able to come and see one of the doctors and things like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> while you're with the doctors, we'd like to do your blood pressure, just examine your, you know, you know, how your walking and everything is.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, while we're waiting, while you're waiting on seeing the doctor if you double up any weakness of your legs or arms or, or, you know, a sudden headache.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any of those symptoms, or you start being violently sick with it, then you know, you would need to take your <UNIN/> to A and E.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But if not, wait for the appointment <UNIN/> for the doctor to examine you um and we'll take it from there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So i'll, i'll send the a prescription at cross <UNIN/> pharmacy looks like it's the Lloyd pharmacy on our system. Is that correct?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. So we'll send you across that prescription. Um, it's called <UNIN/> , yeah? It's one tablet three times a day. So I'll give you <UNIN/> about ten days worth.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: In the interim, obviously in the next few days, you'll get to see one of my doctors and we'll have to just take it from there.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, thank you so much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Any questions at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, can you take, do you need to take those tablets with food? Or can you just take them any time?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It doesn't really matter, you can take it, because sometimes, you know, you get the symptoms as soon as you wake up, so probably you'll feel a bit sick to eat anything so might as well just take the tablets.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, that's great. Thank you so much, that's so helpful.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Just make sure you call support to book that appointment, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I will, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Bye bye now. Bye

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>
